meanings.definition: A steep cliff, bank, or promontory
meanings.sent1: The hiker stood at the edge of the bluffs, admiring the view below.
meanings.sent2: The ship sailed close to the bluffs, careful to avoid any collisions.
meanings.sent3: The bluffs looked like giant steps leading up to the sky.
meanings.sent4: The bluffs loomed over the tiny village like a protective wall.
meanings.sent5: The bluffs cast a shadow over the beach, creating a cool spot to relax.

meanings.definition: To deceive or mislead by a display of strength or confidence
meanings.sent1: She bluffs her opponents in poker by pretending to have a winning hand.
meanings.sent2: He often bluffs about his accomplishments to impress others.
meanings.sent3: The cat bluffs its way into getting extra treats by meowing pitifully.
meanings.sent4: The politician bluffs his way through tough questions during interviews.
meanings.sent5: The magician bluffs the audience with his sleight of hand tricks.

meanings.definition: An act of bluffing in a card game
meanings.sent1: His successful bluff in the poker game earned him a big pot of chips.
meanings.sent2: The player's bluff was so convincing that everyone folded their cards.
meanings.sent3: The bluff in the card game was so outrageous that it made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her clever bluff in the game caught her opponents off guard.
meanings.sent5: The bluff during the card game was a risky move that paid off in the end.
